characters: EXT. FAR, FAR AWAY CASTLE- LATER
BY A MONSTER TRYING TO RELATE TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A familiar beam of light shines down. The beam of light descends onto a stage. Lightning flashes to reveal Prince Charming riding his valiant steed Chauncey across the ope plains. The wind blows back his golden mane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Onward Chauncey, to the highest room of the tallest tower! Where my princess awaits rescue from her handsome Prince Charming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lightning cracks. Thunder booms. Charming straddles a wooden hobby horse and gallops in place. A stage hand use bellow to blow air into Prince Charming's face. Another stage hand turns a crank that creates the moving backgrou In the orchestra, a man uses coconuts to create the sound effects of a galloping horse. Two more stage hands back stage create the cheap sound effects of thunder and lightning. A crudely constructed castle tower sits in fro of a cheaply painted backdrop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fairytale Creatures are sitting at a table in the audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is worse than Love Letters! I hate dinner theatre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinocchio's nose grows as he is caught in the lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prince Charming rides to the base of the tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa there, Chauncey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dismounts and sets his hobby horse on the ground. He strikes a dramatic pose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Princess leans from a tower window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hark! The brave Prince Charming approach-ith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prince Charming puffs his chest out. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear not fair maiden! I shall slay the monster that guards you and take my place as rightful King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old couple at a table look confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to old man) What did she say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prince Charming glares as the bored audience largely igno him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man in a bad ogre costume comes onto the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grrrrrrr!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd erupts into applause. The Fairytale Creatures cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woooo hoooo!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea! Shrek!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first, Prince Charming is put off by the cheers for th Shrek-like beast. He pulls his sword and confronts the monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prepare foul beast to enter into a world of pain with which you are not familiar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is cut off as a waiter enters with a birthday cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday to thee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prince Charming hops out of the way when a chair lands on stage. It slides past him and bumps into the tower facade

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind? Bo-ring! Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience laughs. Prince Charming glares at them and t tries to recover. He points his sword at the monster agai The tower facade starts to topple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prepare foul beast-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prince Charming looks over his shoulder and sees the faca falling. He cringes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scenery slams against the stage, but Prince Charming unharmed, perfectly framed in the princesses' window. The crowd laughs at the embarrassed Prince Charming. He shake his mangled sword at the audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his sword again) Someday you'll be sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We already are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh again. Prince Charming throws down his sword, picks up his hobby horse and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grrrrrrr!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song and the laughter follow Prince Charming backstag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prince Charming walks through a tunnel backstage that lea to a door. The door has a star with his name written on i He opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prince Charming sits at his broken vanity and sobs. His m shift dressing room is in an alley way next to the theate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horses whinny as a carriage passes by. The castle of Far Away can be seen on the hill in the background. Prince Charming breaks down and cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up and sees a picture of the Fairy Godmother tap to the vanity. "Don't stop believing! Mommy's Little Ange is written on the picture. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh mommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He weeps again and then looks back at the picture. A determined change grows across his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're right. I can't let this happen. I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prince Charming looks at the castle on the hill. His expression hardens. He stands and faces the castle. He holds his chin up high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the rightful King of Far Far Away and I promise you this mother. I will restore dignity to my throne!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big gust of wind blows a newspaper page across his face He peels it off and looks at the headline. His eyes tense and narrow.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE CHARMING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And this time, no one will stand in my way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the newspaper is a picture of Shrek and Fiona waving t crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prince Charming crumples up the newspaper in his fists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera booms down from the Far Far Away sign. The sun rises and the birds sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun shines through the bedroom window as the camera p over to Shrek and Fiona waking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... morning breath... Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek breathes in and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Isn't it wonderful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bedroom doors fly open and Donkey and the Dronkeys ru in. The Dronkeys head right for Shrek and Fiona. Shrek cowers beneath the bedclothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Good morning! Good morning!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek sinks further into the blankets as the Dronkeys exuberantly lick him. Fiona is amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey starts to sing "Good Morning" from Singin' in the as he enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The sun is shining through! Good morning! Good morning. (coming closer and closer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "To you!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And you!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dronkeys fly out of the room, knocking down everythin their path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, they grow up so fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek, greatly annoyed, lifts his hand and snuffs out a little fire on the bed left behind by the Dronkeys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not fast enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puss leaps onto the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. You have a very full day filling in for the King and Queen. There are several functions that require your attendance, sir. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great! Let's get started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek immediately pulls the covers up over his head and starts to snore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, lazy bones, time to get movin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey yanks the sheets off of Fiona and Shrek. He is surprised to see Shrek's bare legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaahhh! You know you really need to get yourself a pair of jammies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pans down from a stained glass window. The son "Royal Pain" by the Eels plays in the background as the title: "Shrek The Third" is superimposed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large crowd has gathered to watch the knighting. Shrek walks down the aisle of the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek walks up to the knight who seems a bit nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek takes a sword from Puss, but he doesn't have any id what he is supposed to do with it. Shrek looks at Puss, w indicates how to knight a person with his own sword. Shre starts to knight the knight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knight thee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek accidentally stabs the knight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He-he. Ooh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd, Fiona, Puss and Donkey look on, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek and Fiona officiate at a boat christening for the R Navy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek is holding a bottle of champagne. He leans on the boat, accidentally pushing it down the ramp. Shrek throws the bottle at the boat and it punches an enormous hole in side of the hull. The boat quickly sinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek turns to find the patrons of Far Far Away shaking t heads as they leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raul, the make-up specialist, tightens some aprons around Shrek and Fiona. Donkey, Puss and Raul stand in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, since you're filling in for one, you might as well look like a real King. Can somebody come in here and work on Shrek please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raul stares at Shrek. Shrek raises his eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will see what I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unrolls a satchel full of different gardening tools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Shrek's arms and legs are strapped into a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man stands with his back to the camera and pulls on a r cord as if he's holding a chain saw. VROOM! VROOM! He turns around to reveal a circular sander and starts to gr away at Shrek's gruesome toenails. Shrek cringes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a close-up of Shrek's eye. A mascara brush comes i frame and pulls at Shrek's eyelash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiona gets her nose hairs plucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lipstick is applied to some lips. The camera pulls back t reveal that the lips are Shrek's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand tries to tighten a zipper on Shrek's back. It keep snagging on the skin until they finally rip it past and tighten up the zipper all the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small sock is placed onto Shrek's foot. With a shoe hor Shrek's foot is shoved into a small shoe. POP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A collar is placed around Fiona's neck and her corset is tightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drill comes into frame and tightens the rivet on Shrek' belt. A mole is placed on his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL: Shrek and Fiona standing awkwardly in outrageous Renaissance outfits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puss rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiona is uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, is this really necessary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho, ho. Quite necessary, Fiona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Shrek, you twit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay peoples! This isn't a rehearsal. Let's see some hustle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiles everyone, smiles! Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off-screen, the Master of Ceremonies announces the couple arriving at the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiona turns to Shrek and sees he is not in a good mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how much longer I can keep this up Fiona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Shrek, but can you please just try to grin and bear it? It's just until Dad gets better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek lets out another frustrated sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look handsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Come here, you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a supportive smile. He relaxes and smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiona puckers up her lips and Shrek leans in for a kiss, their bulky outfits prevent it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek and Fiona let out a huge breath of air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my butt is itching up a storm and I can't reach it in this monkey suit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek tries to scratch his butt but to no avail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey you. Come here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man holding a ruby scepter walks over to Shrek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name? Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh, Fiddlesworth, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoo hoo hooo. Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The announcer introduces Shrek and Fiona.

dialogues.speaker: MASTER OF CEREMONIES
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, Princess Fiona and Sir Shrek!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience claps. The curtain starts to open. Fiddlesworth is scratching away at Shrek's butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've done it. Oh, a little over to the left, yeah. That's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh Shrek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiddlesworth struggles to reach Shrek's itch. The crowd looks on in horror. Fiona tries to get his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh! All right, you got it...Oh yeah, you're on it. Oh that's it! Oh that's good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah! Scratch that thing! You got it. You're on it. That's great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek and Fiddlesworth finally see the crowd. They both freeze. Shrek laughs nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Shrek's belt buckle snaps off and hits Donkey in eye. He stumbles through the crowd screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!! My eye! My eye! Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he is stumbling, he grabs hold of a lady in the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman pushes Donkey away. He falls, knocking over a guard holding an axe on his way down. The guard drops the axe. It flies past Puss, who is in the arms of a lady. Th axe knocks over a vase. The vase flies up on stage and Fi maneuvers to catch it. In flight, water spills out of the vase which causes Fiona to fall over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek's tuxedo bib slaps him in the face. The clasp holdi Shrek's pants up breaks off. Shrek stands on stage with h pants around his ankles. He shuffles towards Fiona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiona!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He trips over his pants and hits a loose wooden plank on stage. The plank flings up and sends Fiddlesworth flying through the air where his jacket slips over a banner pole trapping him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek has reached Fiona who is still lying on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiona's eyes suddenly widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiddlesworth's jacket rips and he falls onto a waiter carrying flaming skewers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skewers fly through the air. Donkey stands up in fram with one eye half shut. The flaming skewers shoot by him land in the curtains, setting them on fire. He blows one the skewers out and takes a bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Shrimp! My favorite. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire causes a Far Far Away shield to detach from a wo ceiling beam and fall onto the stage, breaking it in half

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole stage collapses in the middle. The buffet table slide toward Shrek and Fiona at the other end and collide

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to Fiona's room flies open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! We're leaving!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek storms in pulling bits of buffet food off his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, please calm down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek grabs the wig off of his head and throws it aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down? Who do you think we're kidding? I am an ogre! I'm not cut out for this, Fiona and I never will be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek wipes off his makeup with his shirt sleeve and flin his shirt to the floor. He falls onto the bed next to Donkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that went pretty well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek startles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek picks him up and throws him out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aww, come on now Shrek!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek slams the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek turns back towards the bed and sees Puss reclining his pillow. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people just don't understand boundaries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek picks Puss up by the scruff of his neck and tosses outside the window. He shuts it. Puss sits sadly on the ledge, giving Shrek his sad-eyes routine. Shrek draws the blinds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek stomps over and falls back onto the bed. Fiona trie to calm him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just think... a couple more days, and we'll be back home in our vermin-filled shack, strewn with fungus, filled with the rotting stench of mud and neglect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This thought calms him. Shrek takes in a long, deep breat and exhales. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you had me at "vermin-filled."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, uh... maybe even the pitter- patter of little feet on the floor...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. The swamp rats will be spawning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no... you know, what I was thinking of is a little bit bigger than a swamp rat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Shrek. Um... what if -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were little ogre feet? Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shocked, Shrek falls off the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly emerges from behind the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey? Let's try and be rational about this. Have you seen a baby lately? They just eat and poop and they cry and then they cry when they poop and they poop when they cry...Now, imagine an ogre baby. They extra cry and they extra poop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs his hands and looks deeply into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you ever think about having a family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now, you're my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a knock on the bedroom door. The door bursts ope revealing a Royal Page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek springs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, somebody better be dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pushes through a corridor that leads to the Ki bedroom. The King is lying on his lily pad, coughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King inhales and launches into a violent coughing fit Shrek looks a bit guilty about his last admission. The Qu comes to the King's aid and he settles down. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget to pay the gardener, Lillian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Queen is used to these kind of non-sequiturs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King suppresses a few coughs. He turns to his daughte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiona...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I've made many mistakes with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But your love for Shrek has taught me so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiona smiles. The King addresses Shrek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dear boy, I am proud to call you my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm proud to call you my Frog... King Dad in-law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, there is a matter of business to attend tooo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King starts wheezing and coughing. Eventually he stop They think he's dead. Puss solemnly removes his hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Frog King is dead. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiona starts crying. The King suddenly wakes up, coughing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your hat back on, fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek, please come hither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiona gives Shrek a look. Shrek walks over to the King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Kingdom needs a new king. You and Fiona are next in line for the throne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooo. Next in line. Now you see Dad, that's why people love you. Even on your deathbed you're still making jokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King stares at Shrek, stone-faced. Shrek leans in closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on Dad...an Ogre as King? I don't think that's such a good idea. There's got to be somebody else. Anybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aside from you there is only one remaining heir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek brightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really!? Who is he, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is... is... is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his name? What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...is ... Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek leans in closer after each "is," waiting in anticipation. The King starts to hyperventilate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King is dead. A fly comes out of his mouth and flies away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puss starts to take his hat off. The fly buzzes into fram A tongue catches it. Puss puts his hat back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chewing the fly) His name is Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you'll do what's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: riiiight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He succumbs. The King really is dead now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad? Dad? Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey bows his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gingerbread Man is attending school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Settle down, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gingerbread Man graduates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gingerbread Man is driving in his car with the top down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gingerbread Man is making out with his girlfriend at a mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gingerbread Man and his bride run down the aisle as man a wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gingerbread Man is locked in a jail. Farquaad pulls off h legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gingerbread Man is running on a treadmill, doing his rehabilitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gingerbread Man is running through a wheat field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gingerbread Man is still in a dream state singing. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "On the Good Ship Lollypop, It's a sweet trip, To the candy shop, Where the Bon Bons play, On the sunny beach of Peppermint Bay.."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prince Charming becomes frustrated, he turns Pinocchio's towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! You can't lie. So tell me puppet... Where is Shrek?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinocchio thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know where he's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prince Charming gets in Pinocchio's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're telling me you don't know where Shrek is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinocchio is still a little nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wouldn't be inaccurate to assume that I couldn't exactly not say that is or isn't almost partially incorrect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinocchio thinks he has the upper hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you do know where he is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the contrary, I'm possibly more or less, not definitely rejecting the idea, that in no way, with any amount of uncertainty that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I undeniably do or do not know where he shouldn't probably be. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Hook scratches his head, even the Three Little Pi are frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that indeed wasn't where he isn't. Even if he wasn't not where I knew he was could mean that I wouldn't completely not know where he wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gingerbread Man continues to sing his "Lollipop Song."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, enough! Shrek went off to bring back the next heir! Oh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pig realizes his admission and immediately covers his mouth. Pinocchio laughs nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's bringing back the next heir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinocchio's nose grows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hook! Get rid of this new "King."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But bring Shrek to me. I have something special in mind for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll never fall for your tricks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinocchio's nose grows again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat cuts through the open sea. Artie smiles as he watches Worcestershire shrinking away on the horizon. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe it... me a King? I...I mean I knew I came from royalty and all, but I just figured everyone forgot about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks out to sea, disbelieving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, in fact, the King asked for you personally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Wow! Look, I know it's not all gonna be fun and games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It really is all fun and games, actually. Sure, you have to knight a few heroes, launch a ship or two. By the way, make sure you hit the boat just right with the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boat with the bottle? Any idiot can hit a boat with a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek chuckles sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've heard it's harder than it looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!! This is gonna be huge. Parties, princesses, castles... princesses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be great, Artie. You'll be living in the lap of luxury. They got the finest chefs around waiting for you to place your order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puss jumps up onto the railing next to Artie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And fortunately you'll have the royal food tasters. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? What do they do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They taste the food before the King eats, to make sure it's not poisoned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poisoned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek senses trouble and immediately steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or too salty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek turns to Puss and Donkey, trying to shut them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. You'll be safe and sound with the help of your body guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Body guards?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of them, willing at a moment's notice to lay down their own lives out of devotion to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si, and the whole kingdom will look to you for wisdom and guidance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Artie, Shrek mouths "shut-up" to Puss and Donkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just make sure they don't die of famine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or plague.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, plague is bad. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coughing, the groaning, the festering sores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek interrupts with a mock laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Festering sores! Hey, you are one funny kitty cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't want Artie here getting the wrong idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek motions to Artie, but he's gone. They all look arou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Artie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat suddenly pitches to the right. Shrek braces himself. Puss and Donkey tumble away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie swings the wheel around, sending the boat back in t direction of his school. Shrek works his way into the cab and gains control of the wheel. The drunken Ship Captain slides by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Oh, there goes my hip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek turns the wheel the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat veers again, heading back toward Far Far Away. Artie falls to the ground and slides to the back of the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shuffle board stick slides next to Artie. He grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it look like?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jams it in the boat's wheel. The boat lurches. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swings the boat back in the other direction. Shrek ris up and grabs the wheel and turns it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This really isn't up to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie falls underneath the wheel. He stands up shoving th wheel back the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't know anything about being King!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll learn on the job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey and Puss roll across the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoaaa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek grabs the wheel and swings it around. Artie yanks t wheel. They wrestle for control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to disappoint you, but I'm going back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to what? Being a loser?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as the word leaves his lips, Shrek knows he's gon too far. Stung, Artie lets go of the wheel, leaving Shrek yank hard on it. He pulls the steering column from the decking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now look what you did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what I did? Who's holding the wheel chief?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey climbs up onto the railing. He is seasick and is about to puke when he sees jagged rocks ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek desperately sets the wheel back down and tries to s the ship clear of the rocks. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pans past the boat. Off-screen we hear the boa crash into the rocks.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP CAPTAIN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Land ho!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek, holding Puss and Donkey, staggers onto a small bea He glares at Artie who pulls himself out of the surf. Shr drops Puss and Donkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puss, tired of being wet, shakes himself vigorously. His puffs up into a fro. He drops his head in shame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How humiliating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, nice going, Your Highness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so now it's "Your highness?" What happened to "loser?" Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, if you think this is getting you out of anything, well it isn't. We're heading back to Far Far Away one way or another, and you're gonna be a father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie raises an eyebrow. Puss and Donkey stare at Shrek uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearing his throat) A-hem. You just said father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're... I said king. You're gonna be King!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You're gonna be King!" Yeah right. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie shakes his head and marches down the beach toward a path into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you think you're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far Far Away... from you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get back here young man and I mean it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie keeps climbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh boss, I don't think he's coming back and maybe it's for the best. He is not exactly king material.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek looks towards Artie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When were you planning on telling him that you were really supposed to be King?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh c'mon, now why would I do that? Besides, he'll be ten times better at it than me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek starts off after Artie. Donkey jumps in front of Sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, woah ho ho, Shrek. Then you're gonna have to change your tactics if you want to get anywhere with this kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, Donkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek picks up a piece of driftwood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey shakes his head in disgust. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek tosses the log.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh c'mon. It's just a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek walks off, trying to catch up to Artie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie marches up the mountain trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek thinks for a moment and then tries a different tact with the kid. He catches up to Artie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Artie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie looks back over his shoulder. He sees Shrek and jus keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you think this whole mad scene ain't dope, I feel you dude. I mean, I'm not trying to get up in your grill or raise your roof or whatever, but what I am screaming is, yo, check out this kazing thazing bazaby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puss and Donkey glance at each other. Artie notices a cottage in the distance and heads toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, if it doesn't groove or what I'm saying ain't straight trippin', just say, oh no you didn't, you know, you're gettin' on my last nerve. And then I'll know it's... then I'll know it's whack--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing a tree, Artie nonchalantly releases the branch, striking Shrek square in the face and takes off running. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boiling soup pot sits over a fire in front of a small shack. Artie charges though, pounding desperately on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie! Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek, Puss, and Donkey run into the camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon! C'mon! Help! Help! Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a burst of light shoots through a candle box th is hung on the door. A bright, colorful image of an old wizard's head is projected out. Donkey is terrified.

dialogues.speaker: WIZARD HEAD, (MERLIN)
dialogues.text: Greetings cosmic children of the universe, and welcome to my serenity circle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek watches.

dialogues.speaker: WIZARD HEAD, (MERLIN)
dialogues.text: Please leave any bad vibes outside the healing vortex. And now prepare ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a "FZZZZT" and a "BLOOP", the image disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and a tiny old man, Merlin, comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I should of gotten that warranty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin smashes the security device with his little fist a is promptly zapped in the head. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AHH! Ow, ow, ow, ow, ow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Merlin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He was the school's magic teacher until he had his nervous breakdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, technically I was merely a victim of a level three fatigue, and at the request of my therapist and the school authorities, I have retired to the tranquility of nature to discover my divine purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin smacks a fly that has landed on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek and Artie stare in astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, can I interest anyone in a snack or beverage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin offers up a baking dish full of rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you don't wanna try my famous rock au-gratin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin takes a bite and chews loudly. His gums are bleedi from eating rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's organic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both stare at him uncomfortably. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thanks, I just ate a boulder on the way in. What we need are directions back to Far Far Away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the "we"? Who said I was going with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I did. Cause there's a lot of people counting on you so don't try and weasel out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's such a great job, why don't you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understand this kid, it's no more Mr. Nice Guy from here on out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so that was your "Mr. Nice Guy?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, and I'm gonna miss him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? Why don't you go terrorize a village and leave me alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, is that some kind of crack about ogres? You get your royal highness to Far Far Away before I kick it there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now which way am I kicking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I could tell you. But since you're in the midst of self- destructive rage spiral it would be karmic-ly irresponsible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Self-destructive ra...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, are you gonna help us or not? Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most definitely, but only after you take the journey to your soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look pal, it's either that or some primal scream therapy. Ahhhhhhhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek grabs Merlin's mouth and closes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, alright... journey to the soul...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fire blazes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin throws a handful of dirt into the fire, it flares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now all of you, look into the "Fire of Truth" and tell me what you see! Yah! Ha! (Wild war cry) Woo-looo-looo-looo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points at the smoke and it starts to form objects (i.e Rorschach inkblots).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puss and Donkey, excited, sit by the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooo! Charades! Okay, I see a dutch fudge torte with cinnamon swirls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Monster, go for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek glances at the fire. The stroller from his nightmar begins to take shape in the smoke. He blows the image awa He covers his fear and changes the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see a rainbow pony. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent work!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now! The boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is lame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin whacks Artie on the back of the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lame! Now just go for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses more dirt and flames burst up. Artie studies it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. There's a baby bird and a father bird sitting in a nest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin starts beating a drum. Artie's expression starts t change as he stays focused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Stay with it! Stay with it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, the dad just flew away. Why did he leave the little bird all alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek starts to take this in as he watches. Artie gets mo worked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's trying to fly, but it doesn't know how to. It.. it's gonna fall!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Artie catches what he said. As the smoke drifts away, he looks and sees everyone else staring back at him stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whew, proper head case you are, aren't you? Really messed up. Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin goes back inside. They all stare at Artie. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, okay. I get it. The bird's me. My dad left. So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey gives Shrek a nudge to go over and talk to Artie. Shrek hesitates and Donkey insists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Artie...um-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as he's about to get going, "That's What Friends Are For" starts playing loudly from Merlin's security device drowning out any conversation. They all turn toward the shack where Merlin peeks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud, over the music) Just thought I might help set the mood! Y'know for your big heart to heart chat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sheepishly turns off the device and shuts the door. It quiet again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what it's like to not feel ready for something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even ogres get scared...you know, once in a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you want me to be king, but I can't. I'm not cut out for it and I never will be, alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even my own dad knew I wasn't worth the trouble. He dumped me at that school the first chance he got and I never heard from him again. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad wasn't really the fatherly type either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I doubt he was worse than mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? My father was an ogre. He tried to eat me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie looks at Shrek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I guess I should have seen it coming. He used to give me a bath in barbecue sauce and put me to bed with an apple in my mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie chuckles at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... I guess that's... pretty bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie laughs and then pokes at the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, it may be hard to believe what with my obvious charm and good looks, but people used to think that I was a monster. And for a long time, I believed them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie looks up at Shrek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But after awhile, you learn to ignore the names that people call you and you just trust who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie gently pokes at the embers with a stick for a momen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're okay, Shrek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses the stick into the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just need to do a little less yelling and use a little more soap. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Artie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soap's because you stink. Really bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I got that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera slowly booms up and away from the group as the fire continues to burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princesses, Fiona and the Queen are surrounded by darkness as they tiptoe down the steps and into the catac below the castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They round a corner and step onto a ledge with Fiona lead the way, holding a torch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh this place is filthy. I feel like a hobo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiona tries to keep her frustration in check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry but this just isn't working for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleeping Beauty, still being carried by Doris, wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's always about you, isn't it? It's not like your attitude is helping, Snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well maybe it just bothers you that I was voted fairest in the land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean in that rigged election?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, give me a break. (gesturing toward hair)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 70. SNOW WHITE (cont'd) "Rapunzel, Rapunzel, let down thy golden extensions!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies, let go of your petty complaints and let's work together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White and Rapunzel share an indignant look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiona travels deeper into the catacombs. The other Princesses follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess the plan is we just wander aimlessly in this stink hole until we rot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're gonna get inside and find out what Charming's up to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know he's a jerk and everything, but I gotta admit, that Charming makes me hotter than July.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ew!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Fiona spots what she was looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiona, the Queen and the Princesses run towards a long la and climb up through a grate into the main castle courtya

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They peer around a corner and see the construction of an outdoor theater is underway. Two stagehands walk by carry a large dragon set piece. Evil dwarves are busy painting set. The finishing touches are put on the stage tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princesses hug the wall as a group of guards march by

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rapunzel takes off in the other direction, and signals th Princesses to follow her. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, this way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rapunzel. Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiona and the Princesses race after Rapunzel. They spot h sprinting into the castle and follow her. They burst thro the doors and see Prince Charming holding Rapunzel by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charming, let go of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large group of armed Far Far Away Guards surround them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prince Charming smiles at Fiona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why would I want to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grrrr!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woof!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks back at Rapunzel lovingly, and the two share a l kiss. Fiona and the other Princesses are shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hello ladies, to the new Queen of Far Far Away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cinderella claps excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yaaaaaaaaay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princesses stare her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rapunzel, how could you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jealous much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prince Charming eyes up the Princesses. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon you'll be back where you started... scrubbing floors or locked away in towers; that is, if I let you last the week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Pooky, you promised you wouldn't hurt them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here, "kitten whiskers." Daddy will discuss it later. Now forgive us, we have a show to put on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek will be back soon Charming, and you'll be sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops and flashes a sadistic smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry? Don't you realize --once Shrek sets foot in Far Far Away he's doomed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prince Charming leads Rapunzel out. She looks back at the apologetically. Everyone wears a look of defeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards march them off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiona and the princesses are locked away in a prison cell Fiona looks through the bars of the cell, feeling helples

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek startles awake. He sits up and scratches his head, looking around. He realizes it's morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him a peaceful bird lands on a tree branch. Sudden the tree branch that was holding the bird flicks it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek senses the movement behind him and turns around to everything is normal. He turns back around to wake up everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trees start to advance toward Shrek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The log Artie is sleeping on suddenly sits up, knocking Artie, who is still asleep, to the ground. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tree turns around to reveal an Evil Tree. Donkey fina wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Evil Trees continue to advance. A piano is heard. The trees part and Hook is revealed to be playing the piano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music builds to a dramatic finale. Captain Hook turns away from his keys and faces them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out! They've got a piano!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill `em all. Except the fat one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares hard at Shrek and aims his hooked prosthetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King Charming has something special in mind for you, ogre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek is perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "King Charming?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pirates charge forward, swinging in from the tree branche

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One lands and gets his peg-leg stuck in the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pirates close in. Shrek grabs one and throws him to t side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One pirate raises his sword and prepares to swing at Arti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie, Duck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek pushes Artie's head down and the sword narrowly mis him. The pirate prepares to swing again and Shrek lifts Artie above his head. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still in the air, Artie uses both legs to kick the pirate the ground. Shrek and Artie share a satisfied look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pirate charges Donkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puss draws his sword and begins fighting off the pirate, protecting Donkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha-ha! Argh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argh! Argh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pans across the back of the piano to reveal Me happily playing along with Captain Hook. He notices and rudely elbows Merlin out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pirate runs at Shrek, only to be tripped by Artie. The pirate bounces off Shrek's belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready the plank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wooden board is thrown on a stump, creating a makeshift "plank." The pirates back Shrek onto the plank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several pirates with swords force Shrek onto the plank. H is backed up to the edge of the plank and falls into a waiting treasure chest below. Several pirates try to shut lid on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puss, Donkey and Artie are trying to hold off the Villain Suddenly, two Evil Trees come into frame and scoop Puss, Donkey and Artie up in a net.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pirates aim the cannon at Puss, Donkey and Artie. Art starts to panic. Puss extracts his claws and tries to cut through the netting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cannon fuse is lit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek bursts open the treasure chest and stands up with t chest still stuck to his behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek sees the lit fuse and quickly formulates a plan. He grabs two pirates and shoves them into the treasure chest He tosses the chest onto the other end of the plank and catapults himself over to the cannon. At the last second, Shrek is able to aim the cannon in the opposite direction The cannon fires and hits Captain Hook's piano, blowing i into pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Realizing their defeat, the Evil Trees drop the netting t holds Donkey, Puss and Artie. The Evil Trees and Pirates take off running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Hook turns and sees his army running off. He shak his hook in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya cowards!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What has Charming done with Fiona?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gonna get what's coming to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his hook threateningly but it gets caught on an Evil Tree's branch and is dragged away with the rest of t Villains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there ain't nothing you can do to stop him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON SHREK, filled with worry. Nothing else matters t him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie, Puss, and Donkey run over to Shrek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to save her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's so far far away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get yourself back to Worcestershire, kid. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Shrek. Hold on a second. I've got an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin is sitting cross-legged, deep in meditation. Artie approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a buzzing bee, buzz, buzz, buzz...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Merlin, they need a spell to get them...I mean, us, back to Far Far Away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin stops meditating and looks out of the corner of hi eye at Artie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. I don't have that kind of magic in me anymore, kid. How about a hug instead? Hmm? That's the best kind of magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie tries a new approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Merlin please. I know you can

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, forget it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin turns and starts to walk away muttering under his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mumble, grumble, interrupt my healing. Mumble, mumble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie thinks for a moment, staring at Merlin. Artie start to sob. Merlin stops and turns around. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. What, what's with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie continues to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just so hard. You know? They really need to get back `cause their kingdom's in trouble `cause there's a really bad man and it's just so hard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin is visibly uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie's blubbering becomes frustrated and unpredictable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I don't think you understand! There's a mean person doing mean things to good people-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, have a heart old man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie grabs him, now desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they really need your help to get them back! So why won't you help them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie speaks one last, indecipherable line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin is stunned. He doesn't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Okay... I'll go and get my things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin goes into his cave. Artie immediately recovers. Shrek is impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piece of cake. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, well, well. You want some eggs with that ham?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin returns holding a spell book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I am a little rusty, so there could be some side effects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Side effects!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, whatever it is, no matter how excruciatingly painful it may be, it'll wear off eventually... I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin cracks his knuckles. A bolt of lighting shoots out his hands and blows up a rock next to Donkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey and Puss shoot Shrek a pleading look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure this is a good idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if Artie trusts him, that's good enough for me. Even if his robe doesn't quite cover his-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alacraticious expeditious, a zoomy zoom zoom. Let's help our friends get back, um... soon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magic rays shoot out of Merlin's fingers. Shrek, Puss, Donkey and Artie disappear in a puff of smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woah! It worked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reappear and fall out of the sky and bounce through canopy of a large apple tree. They ping-pong through the foliage and land in a heap at the base of the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moan and groan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey adjusts himself, feeling hung over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Puss' body) Oh man, I haven't been on a trip like that since college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Puss' body) What? Is there something in my teeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey's eyes widen. He realizes his voice is coming out Puss' body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Puss' body) Huh? What the?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey (in Puss' body) grabs Puss' hat. He looks down at Puss' boots. His tail begins to twitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Puss' body) I've been abracadabra'd into a fancy feasting second rate sidekick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puss (in Donkey's body) falls from a tree next to Donkey Puss' body).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Donkey's body) At least you don't look like some kind of bloated roadside piata. You really should think about going on a diet! Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Puss' body) Yeah, and you should think about getting yourself a pair of pants! I feel all exposed and nasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Shrek and Artie stare at them. A strained smile past to their faces. They burst out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey joins Puss, both of them scowling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Puss' body) Oh, so you two think this is funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puss is fuming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek and Artie regain their composure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be! You got us back kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek motions to Far Far Away, just a few miles ahead of them. He turns back to Artie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey takes a few awkward steps in Puss' body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Puss' body) Ow, ow, ow, ow, ow. How in the Hans Christian Andersen am I supposed to parade around in these goofy boots?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be very careful with those - HEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puss is shocked by this. He tries to recover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were made in Madrid by the finest- HEE HAW! Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Puss' body) Oh, you'll learn to control that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek, Puss (in Donkey's body), and Artie rush past a wel sign to the town that has been boarded over so it now rea "Go Go Away."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey (in Puss' body) struggles to walk. His tender new feet hurt in their tiny boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously man, you need some comfort inserts or arch supports or something. (noticing Rodeo Drive) Woah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the kingdom, Rodeo Drive is trashed. There is graf everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a carriage driven by Evil Witches comes zooming Rodeo Drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woohoo!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The carriage zips around a corner on two wheels. A drunke Evil Dwarf is almost hit by the carriage while crossing t street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek is shocked by what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crash is heard off-screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... watch it I'm walking here... and I'm gonna keep going...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large explosion is heard off-screen while Little Red Ri Hood pick pockets the Evil Dwarf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A carriage wheel on fire rolls by a marionette theatre wi Pinocchio dancing in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinocchio? Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek and the rest rush over as the curtain starts to go on Pinocchio. He presses his puppet hands against the gla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinocchio!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charming and the Villains have taken over everything! They attacked us but Fiona and the Princesses got away. And now she's-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The time has run out. The cheesy music stops as the curta goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's what?! She's what!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek looks at the marionette theatre and sees how much i costs per show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to Puss in Donkey's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puss, loan me five bucks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Puss, you heard the man, help a brother out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Donkey's body) Do you see any pockets on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Puss' body) Hold on a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey (in Puss' body) removes his boot, he turns it over a bag of money falls onto the ground. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Puss' body) Aha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey (in Puss' body) tosses the money to Shrek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Donkey's body) I had no idea ...really ...I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek quickly dumps the change into the machine. The musi starts and the curtain goes up again and Pinocchio dances

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick, Pinocchio. Where is Fiona?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charming's got her locked away some place secret. You gotta find him! He's probably getting ready for the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The curtain goes down again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, wait! Pinocchio! What show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinocchio's hand comes out from under the curtain and poi to a poster on the wall. Puss reads the poster out loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the poster) It's A Happily Ever After, After All!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek's final performance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The picture shows Charming, sword raised in the air, with foot pinning Shrek, tongue sticking out of his mouth, to ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Puss' body) Whoa, Shrek! You didn't tell us you were in a play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I guess I've been so busy I forgot to mention it! Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 84.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: It's the ogre! Get him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek turns and sees a large group of Charming's royal knights, armed and ready. They drive them back into the alley. Puss (in Donkey's body) steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Donkey's body) Don't worry, Jefe. I got this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He whips his head towards the oncoming guards. His eyes a large and sweet. His lips pout. The guards are momentaril hypnotized by his cuteness, until they realize they're staring at a donkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards recoil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh! Kill it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puss (in Donkey's body) immediately retreats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie glances at the theater poster on the wall and steps forward, confronting the guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, don't you know who he thinks he is? How dare you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek picks up on his plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey, we're dealing with amateurs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards are confused. Artie tears the poster off the wall. Shrek glances at Artie, who steps forward, yanking poster off the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a star people! Hello?! I'm so sorry about this Mr. Shrek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna lose it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assume you have everything ready for tonight! You did get the list for the dressing room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkey marches in. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Puss' body) Yeah, the breakfast croissants stuffed with seared sashimi tuna. Oh, and please tell me you at least have the saffron corn with the jalapeno honey butter cause our client cannot get into his proper emotional state without his jalapeno honey butter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just lost it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...Maybe they should talk to Nancy in Human Resources.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrek pushes the guards aside and continues on towards th castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Donkey's body) Oh, we'll have much to say to Nancy, I promise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards look at each other nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of enchanted trees work on through their dance number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two dwarfs on bungee chords helplessly swing back and for in the rear of the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera lands on Prince Charming reading his lines nex a Shrek stand in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading his lines from a

dialogues.text: With this sword, I do- No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With this sword, I do smote thee! Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without looking, Prince Charming stabs the stand in, who falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the right word? "Smote?" "Smooote." Is that even a word actually? Maybe I should just smite him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unseen stage hands drag the stand-in away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's try this again. Now...
